column4: Hey, can anyone help me with adding startup programs in ubuntu?
startup meaning from the time the computer starts or from the time you login?
yes, I added a startup program in ubuntu using system->preferences->session .. the program runs fine, but I cannot redirect the stdout of the program
um let me try and see
you might just want to put it in .xinitrc
so I added this line in the sessions /pathtomyprogram/program options > /pathtomylogfile/mylogfile 2>&1 .. I don't see the log :(
let me try, I'm going to log in and out brb
I would use ~/.xinitrc instead
thanks for doing this
so just add the command to ~/.xinitrc?
yep :)
let me try it :) .. oh can I create the file if it doesn't already exist?
ya, I'm going to try it too just to make sure
cool
how come .xinitrc doesn't work?
do I need to link .xinitrc to .Xsession?
it didn't work either hang on, .xinitrc works in other distros I use
why doesn't .xinitrc work for me? I've linked it to .xsession, what's going on?
It did not work for me either, so added it to ~/.profile and made it run in the background. It works!
.profile aye, well thanks for the help :)
I still don't understand what happens to the stdout and stderr when the programs are added to the sessions
no clue, but I think it's because the sessions thing doesn't run it from a shell
hmm, maybe they are sent to the endless void called /dev/null ;)
